node.title: Long jail terms for key Belarus opposition pair
node.description: Maria Kolesnikova receives 11 years in jail and Maxim Znak 10 on charges of trying to seize power.

node.title: Palestinians escape Israeli prison through tunnel
node.description: Israel launches a huge manhunt after six militants dug their way out of the high-security jail.

node.title: Ireland eases gathering and wedding restrictions
node.description: Places of worship can operate at 50% capacity, while live music and dancing can resume at weddings.

node.title: Guinea coup leaders seek to tighten grip on power
node.description: Ministers who served ousted President Alpha Condé are ordered to present themselves on Monday.

node.title: Australian boy, 3, rescued after four days in bush

node.title: Minister says veteran suicide claim 'inaccurate'
node.description: James Heappey corrects himself, after he originally said a British Afghan veteran had taken their own life.

node.title: Why sexy spiders are invading our homes
node.description: We may think they're terrifying but the misunderstood house spider is actually just looking for love.

node.title: School closures 'catastrophic' for poor students
node.description: Learning outcomes have worsened in India where schools have been shut due to Covid for more than a year.

node.title: Twins conjoined at head separated in rare surgery

node.title: Australians swap Father's Day hugs across barriers
node.description: Families separated by state border closures meet up at road blocks to exchange emotional greetings.

node.title: Sri Lanka's larger than life legend dies of Covid

node.title: Resistance leader to Taliban: Open to peace talks

node.description: Could the man accused of hatching the plot to fly planes into US landmarks 20 years ago have been stopped?

node.title: The high rolling ex-police chief accused of torture

node.title: Taliban accused of blocking US charter flights

node.title: Taliban accused of murdering female police officer
node.description: The killing comes amid increasing reports of escalating repression of women in Afghanistan.

node.description: Two children are injured by shrapnel, Riyadh says, in an attack the Houthis say targeted Saudi oil.

node.description: The reason for the shooting is not yet clear and there has been no comment from the authorities.

node.title: Police storm Mali jail to free detained commander

node.title: Everyone wrong on Afghanistan - UK military chief

node.title: Soldiers' plea to evacuate Afghan interpreter

node.title: 'I didn't realise how invasive this attack was'

node.title: Clashes in Montenegro ahead of Orthodox ceremony

node.title: 'I studied law in jail - now I want to change the system'

node.title: El Salvador president can seek re-election - court

node.title: Taliban break up women's rights protest in Kabul

node.title: Thousands of Tigray rebels killed, Ethiopia claims

node.title: Who are the rivals to lead Germany after Merkel?

node.title: Kim Jong-un calls for action on climate change

node.title: The man who fought for Kashmir’s freedom from India

node.title: Zorba the Greek composer dies aged 96
